# `dotwhisker`

1. 正确展示；
1. 简单过程；
1. 适应发表。

---

## 一个栗子

* Data: Pew Survey 2005-2009 (`df_pew`)
* DV: 相信美国梦呗？(`meritocracy`)
* IV:
    + 收入(`income_i`)
    + 经济不平等指数(`ginicnty`)
    + 教育(`educ_i`)
    + 党派(`partyid_i`)

---

class: small

## Conventional Presentation

.left-column[

```{r example}
df_pew <- read.csv("data/pew1_w.csv")

m1 <- glm(
  meritocracy~ginicnty + income_i + educ_i + union_i,
  data = df_pew,
  family = binomial(link = "logit")
)

```

]

.right-column[

```{r table, echo=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(gt)
library(gtsummary, lib.loc = .libPaths()[2])

gtsummary(m1, stars = TRUE)

```

]


---

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`

.left-column[

```{r dw-simple, eval = FALSE}
library(dotwhisker)

dwplot(m1)
```

]

.right-column[

```{r dw-simpleFig, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, fig.width = 6}
library(dotwhisker)

dwplot(m1, by_2sd = FALSE, dot_args = list(size = 4)) +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20))
```

]

---

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`

.left-column[

"Compatibility Intervals": Showing the effect sizes that are most compatible with the data
under the given model.

```{r dw-ci, eval = FALSE}
dwplot(m1,
       conf.level = .975) #<<
```

]

.right-column[

```{r dw-ciFig, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, fig.width = 6}
dwplot(m1, conf.level = .975, by_2sd = FALSE, dot_args = list(size = 4)) +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20))
```

]

---

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`

.left-column[

Multiple models

```{r dw-multi, eval = FALSE}
m2 <- update(m1, . ~ . 
             + age_i) #<<
m3 <- update(m2, . ~ . 
             + ideo_i) #<<

dwplot(list(m1, m2, m3))
```

]

.right-column[

```{r dw-multiFig, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, fig.width = 6}
m2 <- update(m1, . ~ . + age_i)
m3 <- update(m2, . ~ . + ideo_i)

dwplot(
  list(m1, m2, m3),
  dot_args = list(size = 4),
  by_2sd = FALSE
) +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20))
```

]

---

class: small

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`

换一种比较方式：

```{r parallel, eval = FALSE}
dwplot(list(m1, m2, m3)) +
    facet_grid(~model, scales="free_y") #<<
```

```{r parallelFig, echo = FALSE, fig.height = 5}
dwplot(
  list(m1, m2, m3),
  dot_args = list(size = 4),
  by_2sd = FALSE
) +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none") +
    facet_grid(~model, scales="free_y") 
```

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`


`ggplot2`扩展

```{r dw-ggplot, eval = FALSE}
dwplot(list(m1, m2, m3)) %>% 
    relabel_predictors(c(ginicnty = "Ginix系数",                       
                         income_i = "个人收入", 
                         educ_i = "教育", 
                         union_i = "是否加入工会", 
                         age_i = "年龄", 
                         ideo_i = "意识形态倾向")) +
     theme_bw() + xlab("Log Odds") + ylab("") +
     geom_vline(xintercept = 0, colour = "grey60", linetype = 2) +
     ggtitle("谁更相信‘美国梦’") +
     theme(plot.title = element_text(face="bold"),
           legend.justification=c(0, 0), legend.position=c(0, 0),
           legend.background = element_rect(colour="grey80"),
           legend.title = element_blank()) 
```

## `dotwhisker::dwplot`

.left-column[

方便发表

```{r dw-polish, eval = FALSE}
plotShape <- rep(c(8, 10, 15) , 
                 each = 6)


dwplot(list(m1, m2, m3),
       dot_args =
         list(
           aes(
             shape = plotShape #<<
             )
           )) + 
  scale_shape_identity() +
  theme_bw() #<<
```

]

.right-column[

```{r dw-polishFig, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, fig.width = 6}
plotShape <- rep(c(8, 10, 15) , 
                 each = 6)

dwplot(
  list(m1, m2, m3),
  dot_args = list(
    aes(shape = plotShape),
    size = 4),
  by_2sd = FALSE
) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none") +
  scale_shape_identity()
```

]

## `dotwhisker::secret_weapon`

.left-column[

Inspired by Andrew Gelman (2005)  

```{r secret, eval = FALSE}
df_byYear <- df_pew %>%
  group_by(survid) %>%
  do(tidy(
    glm(
      meritocracy ~ ginicnty + income_i + educ_i + union_i,
      family = binomial(link = "logit"),
      data = df_pew
    )
  )) %>% 
  ungroup %>% 
  rename(model = survid)

secret_weapon(df_byYear, var = "income_i") #<<
  
```

]

.right-column[

```{r secretFig, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, , fig.height = 6, fig.width = 6}

df_pew$survid <- dplyr::select(df_pew, starts_with("survid")) %>%
  mutate(survid = factor(as.matrix(.) %*% (1:3), labels = c("2005", "2006", "2007", "2009"))) %>% # combine binaries to a factor
  .$survid


df_byYear <- df_pew %>%
  group_by(survid) %>%
  do(tidy(
    glm(
      meritocracy ~ ginicnty + income_i + educ_i + union_i,
      family = binomial(link = "logit"),
      data = df_pew
    )
  )) %>% 
  ungroup %>% 
  rename(model = survid)

secret_weapon(df_byYear, var = "income_i") + 
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20),
        legend.position = "none")
  
```

]

# `interplot`

1. 展示交互效应；
1. 明确何时显著；
1. 排除虚假显著。

---

class: small

## 交互项：又一个栗子

```{r inter-eg}
m5 <-glm(meritocracy ~ ginicnty + income_i + ginicnty:income_i + income_cnty +
      black_cnty + perc_bush04 + pop_cnty + educ_i + age_i + gender_i + unemp_i +
      union_i + partyid_i + ideo_i + attend_i + survid2006 + survid2007 + survid2009, data = df_pew, family = binomial(link = "logit"))

gtsummary(m5, stars = TRUE, coef_map = c("ginicnty" = "Gini", "income_i" = "income", "ginicnty:income_i" = "Gini X income"))
```

---

class: small

## 毛病在哪里？

.left-column[<img src="image/wrong.gif" height = 300 />]

--

.right-column[

$$Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1X + \beta_2Z + \beta_3X\times Z + \varepsilon.$$

交互效应：

$$\frac{\partial Y}{\partial X} = \beta_1 + \beta_3Z.$$
]

--

交互效应variance:

$$\hat{\sigma}_{\frac{\partial Y}{\partial X}} = \sqrt{var(\hat{\beta_1}) + Z^2var(\hat{\beta_3}) + 2Zcov(\hat{\beta_1}, \hat{\beta_3})} \neq var(\hat{\beta_3}).$$

---

## 怎么办？

* Marginal effects + visualization

```{r inter, eval = FALSE}
library(interplot)
interplot(m5, var1 = "ginicnty",var2 = "income_i") + #<<
  xlab("income_i") + ylab("Effect of `ginicnty`")
```

---

```{r interFig, echo = FALSE}
library(interplot)
interplot(m5, var1 = "ginicnty",var2 = "income_i") +
  xlab("income_i") + ylab("Effect of `ginicnty`") +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 20))
```

---

## 分布问题？

Hainmueller, et al. 2018.

```{r inter-dist, fig.width = 8, fig.height = 5, message=FALSE}
interplot(m5, var1 = "ginicnty",var2 = "income_i", 
          hist = TRUE) #<<
```

---

## 解释问题？

```{r inter-prepro, , fig.width = 8, fig.height= 5}
interplot(m5, var1 = "ginicnty",var2 = "income_i", 
          predPro = TRUE, #<<
          var2_vals = c(min(df_pew$income_i), max(df_pew$income_i))) #<<
```

---

## Take Home Points

* Being transparent
* Being modest/scientific
* Using `dotwhisker` and `interplot`
